content: What a stunning winelands setting! The lamb shank melted off the bone and the local Pinotage pairing was perfect. Service was warm and welcoming - true Stellenbosch hospitality. A must-visit!
title: Winelands perfection
author: Wine Tour Group

content: The bobotie was good but I've had better at other Cape Malay restaurants. Nice outdoor seating area under the oaks. Service was a bit slow but friendly. Average overall.
title: Nice setting average food
author: Local Foodie

content: Disgusting! Found a fly in my soup and when I showed the manager he tried to blame us. The kitchen must be filthy. The whole place needs a health inspection. Avoid at all costs!
title: Health hazard
author: Shocked Customer

content: Wonderful farm-to-table experience. You can taste the freshness in every bite. The vegetable garden tour before dinner was a lovely touch. Pricey but worth it for the experience.
title: Farm fresh excellence
author: Cape Town Couple

content: The steak was excellent - perfectly cooked medium rare as requested. Chips were crispy and the pepper sauce was rich. Only downside was the 30-minute wait for food. Worth it though!
title: Great steaks
author: Meat Lover

content: Service here is shockingly poor. Our waiter forgot our drinks order twice. Then brought the wrong desserts. No apology offered. Beautiful location wasted on terrible management.
title: Beautiful view terrible service
author: Anniversary Ruined

content: Lovely Sunday lunch with the family. The roast chicken was juicy and flavorful. Kids enjoyed the garden area to play in. Very family-oriented atmosphere. Will make this our regular spot.
title: Family Sunday lunch
author: The Johnsons

content: The cheese platter was incredible - all local artisan cheeses paired with estate wines. Such a sophisticated offering. Staff were knowledgeable and passionate about local producers.
title: Cheese and wine heaven
author: Cheese Enthusiast

content: Mediocre food at premium prices. The pasta was overcooked and the sauce was clearly from a jar. Only the view saves this place. Disappointing for the Stellenbosch reputation.
title: Overpriced and underwhelming
author: Disappointed Visitor

content: The chef prepared a special vegetarian tasting menu for us - absolute creativity and flavor! Each course was a work of art. This kitchen understands plant-based cuisine. Impressed!
title: Vegetarian paradise
author: Plant-Based Couple

content: Cold food and warm wine - exactly the opposite of what you want! The waiter seemed completely untrained. Had to ask three times for cutlery. Such potential wasted by poor execution.
title: Needs serious improvement
author: Critical Diner

content: Perfect venue for our engagement celebration! The private terrace was romantic and intimate. The champagne and oysters were sublime. Staff made us feel so special. Memorable evening!
title: Engagement celebration
author: Newly Engaged

content: The breakfast buffet is excellent value. Fresh pastries, quality coffee, beautiful setting under the mountains. Fast and friendly service. Perfect fuel before wine tasting!
title: Great breakfast spot
author: Wine Tourist

content: Ordered the catch of the day and received something that definitely wasn't fresh. Complained and was told that's how fish is supposed to taste in Stellenbosch. Insulting response!
title: Stale fish and attitude
author: Seafood Disappointed

content: A lovely spot for a quiet lunch. The quiche Lorraine was light and fluffy, salad was fresh with a zesty dressing. Peaceful garden setting. Perfect for a relaxed afternoon.
title: Peaceful lunch retreat
author: Garden Lover
